snippet: The bloc was lauded for its role over six decades in building peace and reconciliation among enemies who fought Europe’s bloodiest wars.
abstract: Norwegian Nobel Committee makes unconventional choice in awarding the 2012 peace prize to the European Union, celebrating its six decades of postwar integration even as financial crisis and political infighting threaten to tear it apart.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from Paris, and Nicholas Kulish from Berlin. Reporting was contributed by Walter Gibbs from Oslo, Stephen Castle from London, James Kanter from Brussels, Rachel Donadio from Athens, Victor Homola from Berlin, and Scott Sayare and Maïa de la Baume from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The bloc was lauded for its role over six decades in building peace and reconciliation among enemies who fought Europe’s bloodiest wars.

headline.seo: Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to European Union
headline.main: Nobel Committee Gives Peace Prize to European Union
headline.print_headline: Nobel Committee Gives Peace Prize to European Union
